author: yperbasis
content: Addendum: Erigon uses our embedded light-client CL for Sepolia by default. v2.39.0 configures only Shanghai on the EL side for Sepolia, but not Capella in the embedded CL. I've just added that bit to our `devel` branch. Thus it's recommend to build Erigon from the latest source for Sepolia (unless using it with the `--extenalcl` flag â€“  v2.39.0 is sufficient with an external CL). cc <@552133098075193354>

author: chris2_2_2
content: Does the EF have a lawyer on retainer and if so do you provide legal help for execution/consensus layer operators if they are dealing with something concerning their role in creating/propagating blocks in the network? (Serious question as if so we need it, I assume butta needs similar)

author: timbeiko
content: This isn't really on-topic, but in short, no, the EF doesn't provide legal advice. Node operators come in all shapes and sizes, are spread across a huge number of jurisdictions, and should make their own decisions about what services to offer. Obviously, IANAL.
